caption_original: This month, we are celebrating the th anniversary of the Canadian Wildlife Service! Our employees in the Canadian Wildlife Service have worked hard since to protect and manage migratory birds, species at risk, and their habitats. Did you know that they also manage national wildlife areas and Migratory Bird Sanctuaries?...

caption_original: Environment and Climate Change's Committee on the Status of Endangered Wildlife is celebrating years of dedication to wildlife conservation! This group is made up of scientists and Indigenous Knowledge-holders that assess wildlife in Canada. Join us in congratulating this team on years of hard work!... ‎

caption_original: Our weather scientists are testing a new liDAR (instrument that uses light to measure winds) in Iqaluit, Nunavut. It will help improve short term forecasts and provide better information to help safe travel....

caption_original: Last call! The national online photo contest from the Nature Conservancy of Canada ends on November !Enter the contest by sharing photos of beautiful places in Canada on Twitter and Instagram using the hashtag , and you will automatically be entered in the contest, and a chance to win an Essential Phone from Telus! For every entry, TELUS is donating $5 to the Nature Conservancy of Canada! Click the link in our bio to enter today!...
